title: Update to the latest chrono and time
body: This avoids a RUSTSEC warning about `time`.

title: remove changelog
body: (and try to figure out why actions aren't running)

title: export taskchampion-lib as an rlib, too

milestone.title: v0.5.0
milestone.description: The primary goal of this milestone is to "finish" the TaskChampion data model (the meaning of individual properties of a task)  and the sync API.  Both of these have basic implementations, with large bits of functionality still unfinished.

body:
This puts all of the symbols at the top level, and publishes the crate as an rlib.

I suspect this will be the easiest way to make this C code available elsewhere?  At any rate, it was the simplest way I could find to integrate with Taskwarrior.

title: Add `Replica.num_local_operations`
body: This is useful to know if a sync is required.

title: Treat priority as an arbitrary string

milestone.title: v0.5.0
milestone.description: The primary goal of this milestone is to "finish" the TaskChampion data model (the meaning of individual properties of a task)  and the sync API.  Both of these have basic implementations, with large bits of functionality still unfinished.

body:
This matches what TaskWarrior does: priority is a UDA, and can be
redefined by the user's local config.

I dislike this decision, as it means that anything interpreting a task has to either know the user's UDA configurations (and at this point, configuration is not replicated, so that's a local setting); or guess that "L", "M", and "H" mean what they usually do.  But, it's how TW works so we'll stick with it.

@miguelpduarte this will touch similar bits of the code to #348, if you'd like to take a look.

title: Allow taking from pointer lists

milestone.title: v0.5.0
milestone.description: The primary goal of this milestone is to "finish" the TaskChampion data model (the meaning of individual properties of a task)  and the sync API.  Both of these have basic implementations, with large bits of functionality still unfinished.

body:
This introduces `tc_task_list_take`, supporting taking ownership of an
item in a task list.

TCTaskList is the only pointer list, but this is a generic and could be
used for other types.

title: Re-export the chrono crate from taskchampion.

milestone.title: v0.5.0
milestone.description: The primary goal of this milestone is to "finish" the TaskChampion data model (the meaning of individual properties of a task)  and the sync API.  Both of these have basic implementations, with large bits of functionality still unfinished.

body:
The chrono types are central to use of TC, so this will help consumers
of the TC crate to avoid dependency conflicts.

title: Address RUSTSEC-2022-0013.
body: Note that the risk from this vulnerability was minimal for this project.

title: fix some clippy warnings, and make them errors for taskchampion-lib
body: Nothing too exciting here..

title: Add support for expiration
body:
This expires _deleted_ tasks 180 days after their last modification.

In most cases, users' tasks will stay around forever, as they are marked "completed" and not "deleted", but users who wish to keep their task list short can do something like `ta +COMPLETED delete` periodically.

title: use TC_UUID_STRING_BYTES constant directly
body: I spotted this while poking around elsewhere -- taskchampion-lib exposes a literal constant so that cbindgen can reflect its value into the header file.  But it was using a constant from the uuid crate in the code.  They had the same value, so it didn't make a big difference, but (a) this is cleaner and (b) this avoids taskchampion-lib requiring uuid directly.

title: Add support for dependencies
body:
The TC API part of this is, so far, pretty simple.  Supporting modifications in the CLI was a little harder, as it requires "resolving" things like "depends:5" to a UUID, which requires a replica.  But that wasn't too bad, either.

The vritual tags support has me a little stumped, though.  +BLOCKED requires looking at the depended-on task to see if it's still pending.  That's not so bad, but requires a reference to the replica, which most `Task` methods do not (`TaskMut` does, but this isn't a mutation..).  +BLOCKING is even worse, though: it requires, I think, a full scan of the taskdb.

I'll look at how TaskWarrior implements these things.

title: build a C interface to taskchampion

milestone.title: v0.5.0
milestone.description: The primary goal of this milestone is to "finish" the TaskChampion data model (the meaning of individual properties of a task)  and the sync API.  Both of these have basic implementations, with large bits of functionality still unfinished.

body:
I thought I'd get a start on this, and so far it's going OK.

Among other things, this would make it possible to use TaskChampion as the "backend" to TaskWarrior.  It's not clear that's the best plan yet, but even if we don't do so I think this will be a nice addition.

title: add 'entry' key to tasks when created
body: Fixes #326.

title: Support an 'end' key in task maps
body:
This definition matches how TaskWarrior uses the same key.

Fixes #327.

title: Implement `ta import` and `ta import-tdb2`
body:
Fixes #94.

Two caveats here:
 * UDAs are not imported correctly, since we lack type information.  My preferred fix is
   * #328
 * Several kinds of data are not yet supported in TaskChampion.  I've added TODO notes for those.

body:
It looks like we were just using an older clippy?

```
funk ~/p/taskchampion [issue322*] $ cargo clean 
funk ~/p/taskchampion [issue322*] $ cargo clippy 
   Compiling libc v0.2.97              
   Compiling proc-macro2 v1.0.27      
...
   Compiling built v0.5.1
    Checking replica-server-tests v0.4.1 (/home/dustin/p/taskchampion/replica-server-tests)

funk ~/p/taskchampion [issue322] $ cargo version
cargo 1.57.0 (b2e52d7ca 2021-10-21)
```

title: Support 'undo'
body:
This adds undo support as discussed in #92, including documentation of the data model used to support it.

@tomasj you may want to have a look here, as well.  This is the approach I'd like to take in Taskwarrior.

title: fix a few lints in clippy 1.57
use strum_macros::Display to display Status
body: Fixes #318.

title: Fix application of modifications during 'ta add'
body: Fixes #317.

title: Define UDAs
body:
This defines UDAs and provides a basic Replica/Task API for setting, removing, getting, and enumerating them.

The docs update suggests UDAs with a namespaced format.  The idea is to avoid name collisions, either with future additions to the data model (by virtue of using `.`, while the data model separates things with `_`) or between applications using the API.  It's worth noting that no existing TW tools follow this format, but a programmer can dream.
